title: Academic/Teaching Interview
Interview Descriptions: I met with four people and each took turns to interview. Starting the leader to the rest of the search committee. he spent about 30 minutes but they plan to get back as soon as they can
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, your work, and all that are important to you

title: Work Study Student Interview
Interview Descriptions: Really easy, simple! Nice people and good to work with! They made you feel comfortable! I think it was a great opportunity for a student to gain some experience! They would contact you and ask for more information!
Interview Questions: What can you contribute to this job?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at DeSales University in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: First interview was over the phone. The second interview was in person. The second was with each member of the staff that I would interact with. Everyone was very nice and asked the usual questions.

title: Grad Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at DeSales University (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: - 2 Interview rounds with an onsite interview - You'll then conduct an interview process with the team you're meeting which can be intimidating for some but overall a great structure
Interview Questions: What makes you a great fit for this role?

title: Server Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at DeSales University (Center Valley, PA)
Interview Descriptions: There was no interviewing process. The occupation was on my Universities campus. It was not a work study. Although, I attended the school. That was good enough for the facility.

title: Desk Attenedent Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at DeSales University (Center Valley, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Was brief and informal, we discussed how the role worked and what duties played as a priority.  The process was streamline, and could not ask for a bette experience.
Interview Questions: Why would you like to obtain this position.

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at DeSales University
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with HR and Admin. Took an informal typing test while editing and correcting any errors. Second interview set up to meet with President was very pleasant. From there on was in contact with HR for background check and references. Easy and welcoming HR representatives. Admin called during the process upset at HR for taking too long. Looking back this was a sign of things to come.

title: Associate Professor, Chair of A Department Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at DeSales University (Center Valley, PA)
Interview Descriptions: They conducted a national search. I found the job posting on the Chronicle of Higher Education, and applied. Was given a telephone interview and then asked to come to campus for a personal interview. It was a good fit.
Interview Questions: I was new to academia, fresh out of grad school, only having served 1 year elsewhere as a sabbatical replacement. So this was my first real full-time position in academia, leading the department. They asked me how I expected to take on the responsibilities with so little experience.

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at DeSales University (Lansdale, PA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: The head of the department interviewed me and hired me.  It was very low key and friendly.  The head of the department was extraordinary.  He was Dr. David Gilfoil.
Interview Questions: They asked about my experience in business and in teaching.

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at DeSales University (Center Valley, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Email from department head about opportunity, met with 3 people, 2 of which daily contact was anticipated. Offered the job within days.

title: PA School Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at DeSales University (Lehigh Valley, PA) in Nov 2010
Interview Descriptions: know what a PA really is like, dont thinkt he title before your name is important
Interview Questions: as a interviewer, what would u like to see in a interviewee
